comment.text:
Seasoning is the name of the game here. Food was seasoned to perfection, even the croissant sandwich was packed full of flavor. Shrimp and grits were perfect, served hot and fluffy, the perfect consistency. 

Staff was extremely friendly, the chef himself even came out to check on everyone and their experience. Small spot with limited seating, but definitely worth your while.

photos.caption: Small spot, stayed poppin' the entire time we were there.

comment.text:
I decided to try The Food Shoppe since it was one of the higher rated places to eat in the downtown area. There are a few tables to sit down and eat, but it definitely leans more toward takeout. 

Everything on the menu looked good, but I decided to go with a small shrimp and grits bowl ($13), since I haven't had grits in a while. I forgot to take a picture because it smelled so good that I just dove in, and by the time I remembered to take one, it was no longer aesthetically pleasing. The first thing I liked was that they removed the tails from the shrimp, so you don't have to discard them and get your hands dirty. The cheesy grits had excellent flavor and the dish had a mild kick to it. My only complaint was that it didn't work proportionately because I had a lot of leftover plain grits at the end. I love grits, but it hits different with the cheese and shrimp missing!

Service was friendly and the food was prepared quickly! I would definitely revisit to try their mac and cheese as well as some desserts.

Pretty good. Sorta shoestring home cooked presented as fast food take out containers vibes. It seems to have big fans on Yelp. 

I liked the red beans and rice a lot. My gumbo was more meh. The meats were nice quality and cooked well and the gumbo had a nice herbal note but was too salty and sorta thin. 

The rice is that par boiled stuff. They could do better than that. 

They have a big array of cake slices on display. 

Amazingly they were out of hot sauce!

The people were super nice. I would go back for a quick bite. Probably would try the jambalaya next time instead of the gumbo.

I can't recommend this place enough! The flavors were soooo good! They were so friendly and helpful. Everything looked amazing on the menu. The Mac and cheese was seasoned so well! They knew cheese was not the only flavor to put in there. The chicken was tender and delicious. Small inside so not much seating, but they've made most of their food easy to eat while walking around downtown. I wish I could've eaten everything there.

My husband and I enjoyed our food from The Food Shoppe. I ordered the Mac and cheese & the chicken was seasoned so well. My husband really enjoyed the Jambalaya which he also added extra meat to. They gave it to us straight off the stove. We ate some of our food in the restaurant and then took it back to our hotel to finish & it was still hot!

We were a disappointment that there was no ice. I wanted to try their house punches or teas. They had punch but they said they didn't have ice so I settled for a water and my husband got a soda.

photos.caption: Mac & Cheese with Ooey Gooey Chicken and Mac

comment.text:
Cute little shop in downtown Atlanta. Seating is very limited and it is very hot and noisy inside. They have music playing and a big fan blowing which makes it hard to even place your order. 

I waited in line and a lady took my order and she was nice but could've been friendlier. There was a long line and it appeared it was just her and the cook so she was getting flustered. Anywho, after placing my order it took about 25-30 minutes for my order to be ready. They give it to you in a takeout bag, even if you're eating there. I got a small jambalaya and it was good but nothing spectacular. Although the flavor was good, the rice was overcooked.

Customer service 80 out of 10
The atmosphere 10 out of 10
The chef 10 out of 10
The voodoo bbq chicken & mac 8.5 out of 10
The voodoo Jambalaya 9 out of 10
The homemade juices 10 out of 10
The red velvet (hurt my soul) 5 out of 10 need to go easy on the coco powder
Bread pudding 100 out of 10
(No picture of food we ate to fast)

Based off of a friend's recommendation I stopped by to pick up take out for my dinner. I got the ooey gooey Mac & cheese and it was incredible. I got the regular size and it was a lot of food. It was delicious and very rich. This is a good spot if you're staying in the hotel district, but the inside is rather small so I would recommend take out. The workers I spoke with were very welcoming.
Not much to look at but the food is amazing!!!  We had Mac and cheese with chicken and some bread pudding. They were delish.

We ordered shrimp &  grits and pasta Yaya. Shrimp & grits was a mix of lumpy flavorless grits with cheese on the top. Only a person who has no taste buds would like it. A few pieces of shrimp with a box full of grits. Same is the case for the pasta. A strange mix of flavors thrown together translating to a weird concoction. We had a taste of both and trashed both the dishes.  And for a takeout the food was not cheap. I wish I could give a 0 star.

Wow. Yelp came through again! This little hole in the wall was just amazing! The wife and I stopped in after a day of sightseeing around downtown Atlanta, and we could not have chosen a better restaurant. As soon as we walked in we knew it was going to be good. The restaurant was old and run down, but had those major hole-in-the-wall vibes. 

I ordered the small voodoo Mac and cheese with a small red beans and rice. My goodness, I'm glad I didn't get the regular size because it was PLENTY of food - and I'm a large man. It was enough to where we took the leftovers back to the hotel and had it for dinner too! My wife had the shrimp creole omelette and it was gigantic! She had plenty to take home for dinner also. 

The best part about it was that the flavors were new to us and it was great trying something different. Everything tasted absolutely amazing and I would definitely love to come back. The service was also very friendly and welcoming.

Food: I loved it enough I came back again.
Baked chicken on Mac & cheese and the jambalaya were absolutely delicious & tasted high quality not excessively greasy, and portions of chicken, shrimp, sausage were good. 
Only reason not 5 stars is it does take a bit to get your food, like I'm glad that means it's fresh but I was late returning to my conference. 
one person working front is kinda overwhelmed, and the tables were not cleaned- there's a couple outside and tables & counter inside. 
Also one staff person was pretty sweet & the other time the person kinda acted like they didn't want to be bothered.
Desserts looked good but I had no room to try them. I found good portions here good & filling

We came here for dinner on a whim after realizing our initial dinner choice was closed for the holidays, and they were gracious enough to take our order just fifteen minutes before they closed. Our food was ready quickly given it was a primarily takeout place, but I found it a little pricy for that. Still really enjoyed the food once we got back to our hotel! The gumbo was deliciously seasoned and generously filled with sausage, chicken, and shrimp, though I would have liked some veggies too like okra or onions. The chicken creole pasta was also seasoned great and packed some heat. I do think the chicken in both dishes could be cut a bit smaller to make them easier to eat without a knife. All small complaints though, it was still a great surprise meal that reminded me how I should eat more Creole food!

I really want to give this place 5 stars but, if I was going to rate my overall visit then I gotta be honest. This was my first restaurant to try in Atlanta and I was super excited. When you first walk in, it looks like a small hole in the wall kind of place. 
There's not a lot of place to sit but, their food options looked great. We ended up ordering their Yaya Pasta and Jambalaya. 
The service was definitely not what I expected. The lady was kind of rude and not welcoming at all. I tried to have small talk and ask what they recommended and did not get any response. 
The food on the other hand was amazing!! It was delicious! The spice level was perfect and it's a great spot to fulfill that southern food craving!

Get the voodoo jambalaya! The rich bbq sauce pairing with the flavors of the jambalaya is a perfect meal! Small size was perfect enough for me. Lots of quality protein like juicy chicken and shrimp with sausage! The rice was delicious. 

The staff was very friendly! They have outdoor seating and a few indoor tables. Highly recommend coming here! I wish I tried their other menu items.

I'm in town for a customer meeting and staying at the Home2 Suites. The front desk provided a bunch of walking distance places but this place was not on the list and it should have been.

I ordered the Red beans and rice with sausage, not chicken, and Angie's bread pudding. It was not disappointing, the RB&R was just the right amount of flavor and heat that made the meal taste great. Not too spicy but just enough to keep it traditional. Big chunks of smoked sausage and firm beans in a tasty sauce. At first I was a bit concerned about the portion but it was definitely a lot to eat.

The bread pudding was phenomenal, it was enormous and two people could have enjoyed it but I took it upon myself to indulge. The only thing that may have made it a bit better was to add some whipped cream 

I would have given a 5 star review but the restaurant is a bit small and the soda fountain was broken so I had to buy two cokes with the food. It was a bit hot and odiferous but I guess that adds to the ambiance. The young lady behind the counter was amazing in person and very sweet on the phone when I first called before I headed out which was a great first impression. The only regret I have is that I'm only in town for one night, otherwise I would be trying the Yaya next.

photos.caption: Red Beans and Rice w/ Sausage- Yummy

comment.text: Wanted to try some good food after a long night and I ran into this place. It had good reviews and I could see why. This place has a unique interior and very friendly staff. Food came out pretty quickly and tasted awesome! The chicken was cooked well and complemented the mac & cheese. I highly recommend this place.

Food was so good and so was the customer service! There was a miscommunication in what we originally ordered so the manager brought us out what we originally wanted plus samples and free drinks. 10/10 support your small businesses!

Great local spot with amazing fresh, hot jambalaya. It's a cozy little restaurant with a few indoor and outdoor tables, perfect if you want your food to go or for casual dine-in. This is the second time I've been here and it's been great both times. Staff is very friendly, prices are fair for the amount and quality of the food you get, and it has a nice selection of items. All day breakfast items as well!

photos.caption: Regular Jambalaya. Nice size. You'll be full after for sure.

comment.text: I wandered in here searching for gyros only to find creole cuisine. It hit the spot. Yummy, greasy, spicy pasta was just what I wanted. Service was amazing. The space was very comfortable with the game on and nice music playing.

photos.caption: I thought I was walking into Gyro Bros
Small voodoo Mac and large pasta
Pineapple fruit punch and Orange creamsicle drink. Yum

comment.text:
Delicious cajun food.
Warm homey staff and yummy food.

Everything I tried was delicious. The seafood bisque was warm and flavorful. The creole omelet was ooey and gooey. The shrimp and grits were creamy and buttery. They hit home with this place!

Loved my time here, would come again!!

An unfortunate missed opportunity on the day I visited. The wait for food was cumulatively 40 minutes, which is understandable because one woman was running the entire front of house.

The food, however, did not live up to the wait. I had the voodoo chicken jambalaya, and the cloying sweet BBQ sauce completely drowned out the other flavors. A reasonable amount of chicken and shrimp were included, but the rice was low-quality and the dish had a heavy amount of added corn starch. At $14 for a small portion, it was a disappointment.

I wanted to love this restaurant bc my fiancé and I love creole food but unfortunately it missed every single mark. The restaurant is very loud due to the blowing fans, the cashier was a short round woman and she seemed very irritated when providing service even though we were the only customers. 

I wanted to order one of their homemade drinks ($5) but she said they ran out of cups. The clear cups that they had were for another kind of drink. The prices are high once you see how your food is prepared. We dined in and everything was prepared in a meal prep container. The food was not very hot and tasted like it was previously prepared. 

I had the chicken mac, I didn't finish it and I didn't take my leftover home. The chicken was over cooked and very salty...the Mac and cheese was super oily. My fiancé had the jambalaya, he said nothing tasted like it was made together and the celery was crunchy in the dish so he thought it was gristle.

The ambiance is a New Orleans carry out. The decor is okay. There is enough seating for about 15 people inside and some seats outside.

photos.caption: Front entrance, a homeless man kept coming in and out trying to steal a sprite.
Parts of the chicken were dried out like a jerky. This was the larger plate, all orders are provided in a meal prep container.
Jambalaya just tasted okay. It def looks better in the photo.
You can taste the dye in the icing.

comment.text:
We visit this place when we arrived in Atlanta. My Husband and I was looking for some quick bite and this place hit the spot. We order the jambalaya and my husband order the grit. 

I enjoyed my jambalaya. It has great flavor and the portion was huge. My husband enjoy his grits. He said that it was good but it was not that amazing. So I would say that if you decide to come visit this place and you can only buy 1 item. I would say sticks with the Jambalaya. 

What more can I say. Cheap meal, huge portion and great tasting food.

Not my favorite Creole spot... Stopped by with my coworker for dinner. We found the Food Shoppe on our hunt for eats unique to Atlanta and came away disappointed. Yikes.

For COVID safety purposes, some staff wear masks. The shop is tiny, very family-owned kind of setting. We came in on a Monday evening and were seated immediately, though the food took around 30 mins to come out. Being the only patrons there, we expected quicker service... Or at least table service! You pick up your order (already packaged to-go) at the counter when they call your name.

VOODOO JAMBALAYA: Far too sweet. They really drown this in BBQ sauce to the point where, IMO, it's nearly inedible. Hard to enjoy the actual Jambalaya and proteins when this is so overwhelmingly syrupy. Scraping the sauce off only made everything else taste bland. Welp

My coworker's Creole Chicken Pasta turned out wildly underwhelming... The chicken tasted a bit like tuna, while the pasta was completely bland. Smelled a bit like cat food. I'm hesitant to come back, even with the positive reviews. Maybe the kitchen had an off day...

This place was really good. It's kinda hard to find because the sign outside is really tiny and just on the window

It's a tiny shop & has a real local feel to it. Everyone in there was talking about how good the food was and the staff all seem to care about their food. 

It's not the cleanest or nicest place but the food really was delicious. They give huge pieces of meat and plenty of sauce in the voodoo jambalaya for $19 

Only a few tables inside for seating so not good for groups. They had one bathroom that I think you can use 

The cinnamon roll was amazing. The frosting was mouth watering good and the smell attracted people near us when we made our way back to dragon con $6 

Good stop for dragon con

Came in on a whim and so glad we did! Food was excellent. We got the shrimp and grits and the ooey gooey mac and cheese with chicken, both were great. The chef came out at one point and asked how the food was, what he could improve, etc. Super sweet guy, told him we had no complaints and that he did a great job.
Tried to get breakfast @TFS this morning(10am). Staff was outside waiting for food delivery. They were kind and apologetic.  Will update review if I get to try!

Overpriced and not worth the hype. 

I read all the good reviews so decided to come here after landing in Atlanta and walking around for a bit. 

Service was very very slow despite it being not that busy. 30 mins go by with 6-8 ppl in front of me, I finally get to the counter and overhears them telling the party in front of me they were out of shrimps in everything. But they were still letting you order things that are supposed to come with shrimps, like the jambalaya I wanted to order. (Along with everyone else). I didn't get it bc it Just didn't make any sense to pay the same price and not get half the ingredients. Not sure how they were okay still selling it. 

I ordered the chicken pasta instead, waited another 10+ mins to get it. 

Extremely underwhelming. Tasted fine but in a "hamburger helper" boxed dinner way. 

Thought about going back to try the jambalaya another day but decided not to waste more money there.

Even in a city with as many fantastic food options as Atlanta, The Food Shoppe should make it on your "must visit" list. I opted for the southern omelette, which would have been enough food for two. Delicious omelette, grits, and small sides of their croissant and cinnamon roll - yum! I would have taken the leftovers to go if we weren't getting on a plane a few hours later.

Staff were friendly, food was served up quick, and the place was super clean. They've also got the coolest floor in the neighborhood!

photos.caption: Southern Ham Omelet - comes with potatoes, grits, part of a cinnamon roll and a bit of croissant! Delicious. More than enough for two.
Two tables and some stool seating. April 2022.

comment.text:
Stumbled across this little hole in the wall place downtown a few blocks from Centennial Park. 
*reasonably priced 
*HUGE portions 
*friendly service 
*DELICIOUS food!- everything was sooo good. The shrimp in the poboy were giant. The mac&cheese and grits were over the top cheesy in a good way. Fries nicely seasoned, hot and crisp. You can tell the desserts were made with so much love. 
Definitely a must when in ATL.

It's a pretty small shop on Luckie St. so don't miss it! I ordered by phone for a Jambalaya for pickup. Got in and got my food in a few minutes. Service was very friendly! The shop was also very cute - would be a great place to sit and eat, too, if I had extra time.

(Excuse the photo if the jambalaya looks a little dry - I didn't get back to my place to eat it until nearly two hours later, but I'm sure it looked nice and juicy when fresh!) The jambalaya was super delicious. LOTS of sausage, shrimp, and chicken. Great cajun seasoning and sauces added on top. I loved every bite - they were all filled with so much flavor. 

Street parking or the small parking lot at the end of the block. (FYI: They're VERY quick to ticket you if you forget to pay, even if you're just picking up ... ).

Highly recommend and I will definitely go back! I need to try out the rest of their menu.

Ok. So the food was 10/10. I had to purchase more to take home! The food was unmatched. However, 
the customer service was horrible.  The staff really need to be coached on providing better customer service. I will not go into details with what happened but on today there were two elderly females working the counter between 200pm- 03:00pm. The worker who actually provided the food to us was overly rude. With such great food, I am unsure why they would  allow anyone like her to work in their establishment.

Hands down the best creole food you will have in Atlanta. This is as close to Nola as you will get.  The chef if so amazing. So nice. And exudes customer service.   I love every dish. It's all made with love each and every time.   The bread pudding.  Lawd. It's soo gooodt!!!    Get you a piece like right now.   The workers are not as polished  but that's ok with me.  They are down to earth and friendly.    Then my peoples!!

The food was delicious and the service was amazing. Both of the gentleman in the establishment were very pleasant and went out their way to make sure we had everything we needed. The free Icees and the samples of bread pudding were bonuses. We will definitely visit again when we are in Atlanta.

photos.caption: Voodoo BBQ Chicken and Mac with Shrimp

comment.text:
Y'all know I don't give out 5 stars often but JESUS!!!! 
I'm going to get to the food but I tasted Heaven. They have the ABSOLUTE best bread pudding I have had in my life. I mean THE BEST. It was buttery, the caramel was amazing it was perfect. I've thought about it 10 times a day since having it. 

I had the jambalaya... It was YUMMY. This restaurant is owned by a family from New Orleans. They are so
Sweet & kind. The wife is so humble like she really doesn't know that the ancestors are putting their feet in her food alongside hers... Back to the jambalaya... It was seasoned to perfection & I got the small portion but it had me full for the rest of the day. I knew it was going to be good when I ordered the lobster Mac & cheese and she told me that had been sold out SINCE THE MORNING...but the jambalaya did not disappoint at all!! It was sooo good. I can't wait to go back... that bread pudding is calling my name

I don't have anything spectacular to say about this, except for the bread pudding that my girlfriend couldn't get enough of. My shrimp and grits were okay, and I only got that because they ran out of bread for the sandwich I really wanted. They also didn't have any cups, so we couldn't try homemade juice. A restaurant without cups is a new one. Customer service is virtually 
non-existent, so good luck with that. I doubt I'll be returning.

Let's see do I recommend this place...Absofknglutely!! This tiny little gem is a must try if you are in the area. While I was working the Peach Bowl I found this place while walking back to the hotel from a very long day at work. The limited menu had so many things I wanted to try and I opted for the Pasta Yaya. Excellent choice! If I'm ever back in the area for another televised event I'll be sure to stop by again. 

Yes it's half eaten as I couldn't stop while writing this post.

Best Jambalaya I've ever had!!!
Also, the staffs were very kind :)
I will definitely be back when I come to Atlanta

photos.caption: Voodoo jambalaya Red bean rice  Pasta yaya  Side of potato cheese on top

comment.text:
I found this place a little over a year ago on accident and I was never able to find it again until last week! Everything was still exactly the same, amazing and friendly staff, a small yet welcoming environment, and mouthwatering food at a great price

I honestly hate going here by myself because I can only get so much food whereas when I go with a group we pretty much order the entire menu and share everything ha ha Ha but seriously though everything on the menu is absolutely delicious from the breakfast two they're delicious desserts you want to make sure you try everything on the menu here

I would have to say my absolute favorite would be the mac & cheese, it's almost like a soup because it is so creamy but I promise there are no complaints on the side. Hands-down some of the best food I've ever had in my life

You hear the stories about a hole in the wall being the best places- this is definitely one of those. A lot of "creole" places sport the name but don't deliver on the spices, not this place. The food slaps, and the lady who took our order/gave us the food was incredibly nice.
Came to Atlanta for my son's basketball tournament. Went to the food shoppe on our first day. Food was so so good.

The restaurant is very small. I walked by around 5:30 PM on a weekday and it was empty but still have to wait for a few minutes to order (kinda odd bc I later realized the staff was gathering at the door when I walked in". The food was REALLY good though. Got a small Voodoo Jambalaya and finished it all!!
The food was amazing! Cute little place, very reminiscent of Louisiana.  The service was impeccable

The food here was awesome. Very flavorful and you're given a large portion for what you pay for. We had plenty to take home with us. The service tho, was below subpar. The lady at the register was beyond rude, had no customer service and seemed agitated as soon as we stepped foot inside, that we were even there to say the least. She wouldn't speak up or assist us with anything and when we asked questions she just looked at us like we were idiots. I see there's another location so maybe when we return we'll try that one but this location and experience sucked simply off of the rude woman running the register.

Our first stop once we landed.  Long wait for our food although it wasn't busy.  Food was tasty but nothing over the top.  Wings were a little dry although the voodoo sauce was good. It did the job in a pinch.

photos.caption: Voodoo Mac n cheese, voodoo wings and jambalaya

comment.text:
Was on business in Atlanta for a conference and noticed this hidden gem with it's sandwich board sign!  Perfect location by the Centennial Park and I got Luckie on Luckie Street!


I had the Jambalaya and wife had the Shrimp Po' Boy, EXCELLENT service and the food is simply to die for!!

The jazz on the sound system is PERFECT and purrs rather than overwhelms you.

Price is definitely worth the serving a and the staff are warm and friendly!

The food is quite delicious, so I'm disappointed to type this review. Unfortunately the workers here will open and close the restaurant whenever they feel inclined to, despite the hours posted on Yelp or Google. This blatant disregard for customers' time, is quite telling. I will no longer support this restaurant, but if you go, yes the bread pudding is yummy! Peace!

They opened 40 mins later! But I'm hungry! :) 3 stars
When I first walked in I saw the plus size black lady in her 40-50s and I knew the food was gonna be good! Did not disappoint!

Don't expect much pizazz in the shop because it's good enough that their food is good and it comes out pretty quick.
Even a small size of the jambalaya is a lot of food and meat!
Certainly encountered some characters downtown while you're sitting inside eating your food but as long as you're caught up in the deliciousness, pay no mind.

Highly recommend getting the bread pudding (it comes to you warm and so yummy)
